Note: A similar French scrap occurs in Oxford, Bodleian Library Digby 86 (SC 1687), f. 114 ‘Jolif te / Me fest aler ad p[r]e’.
_description: A tag, the first two lines of a popular song, quoted in a Latin exemplum De Guloso, introduced with ‘Quadam autem die sic comedit,et postea versus silvam ivit, incipiens istum cantum’

BLHar2316.Transcription: Jolifte JolifteMaket me to ye wede the
